content.description: Sit start under the block on a good left hand and minimal feet.  If you use the small block below for the start it is more like V0.  Bump up with your right hand over the front end, and muscle through for the topout.
content.location: It is at the base of The Quarry Crag in front of "The Closer."

content.description:
Sit start on the ramps and move straight up the quarried face to good crimps. From there bump up to the ledge and make some tricky moves to a delicate top-out.

 For shorter climbers this might require compressing with a barely there sidepull and the drill holes.
content.location: It is uphill 1 minute in the abandoned quarry. This is the center face with the rising ramp.

content.description: Sit start on the ramp in the corner of the elevated alcove on the left side of the quarry wall. Move up the ramp and into the flake to a tricky mantle. Moving up through the corner offers a much more secure V1 variation.
content.location: This is about 1 minute uphill from the Meteorite Boulder in an old, abandoned quarry.

content.description: Sit start the tall arete without the big wedge at mid-height.
content.location: This ascends the far right arete on the quarry wall about 1 minute uphill from the Meteorite Boulder

content.description: Sit or stand start the split crack on the right side of the upper platform/tier of the quarry. There is a drill/tool mark running the length of the crack. Get a few nice jam to an exposed topout. The FA is likely a long past quarryman.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter at the edge of the platform/tier.
content.location: This is on the right side of the upper platform/tier in the quarry.

content.description: Stand start the slopey left arete in the quarry alcove.
content.location: It is uphill one minute from the abandoned quarry.

content.description: Sit start on the ramp just right of the triangular feature below the drill holes. Traverse up the ramp on slopers, eventually gaining face holds and mantel up when you reach the end of the ramp. People will think you're just hauling on bad hands but the feet are crucial to sending this climb. Be careful not to fall back or dab on the boulder behind you!
content.protection: You may be able to slide a pad under the beginning but the alley you traverse though gets narrow and makes it hard to avoid dabbing. Luckily it stays low enough to just step off the climb.
content.location: The sit start is in the middle of the center section of the quarry. Look for a waist-high ramp about 10 feet right of the giant detached flake, below and slightly right from the two prominent drill holes on Visitor Pass.

content.description: Start with your hands on a low, wide undercling as well as a higher sidepull. Move up through obvious crimp features to a tricky topout.
content.location: It is to the left of Self-Reliance on the left end of the upper pedestal.

content.description: Climb the tall, low-angle slab on the hillside left of the quarry. Start your climb with your feet climbing up the right-trending seam until you can move left onto the face with your hands in the next seam up. Finish up the center of the slab with fun, exposed moves.
content.location: Facing the quarry hole, you'll see a slab on the left side un-quarried hillside. The route goes up the center of the tallest part.

content.description: This is a small quarry with a few problems.
